verses.verse: Yahweh<WH3068> sent<WH7971> Nathan<WH5416> to David.<WH1732> He came<WH935> to him,<WH559> and said to him,<WH8147> "There were two men<WH582> in one<WH259> city;<WH5892> the one<WH259> rich,<WH6223> and the other<WH259> poor.<WH7326>
The rich<WH6223> man had very<WH3966> many<WH7235> flocks<WH6629> and herds,<WH1241>

but the poor<WH7326> man had nothing,<WH259> except one little<WH6996> ewe lamb,<WH3535> which he had bought<WH7069> and raised.<WH2421> It grew up<WH2421> together<WH3162> with him,<WH1121> and with his children. It ate<WH398> of his own food,<WH6595> drank<WH8354> of his own cup,<WH3563> and lay<WH7901> in his bosom,<WH2436> and was to him like a daughter.<WH1323>

A traveler<WH1982> came<WH935> to the rich<WH6223> man,<WH376> and he spared<WH2550> to take<WH3947> of his own flock<WH6629> and of his own herd,<WH1241> to dress<WH6213> for the wayfaring man<WH732> who had come<WH935> to him,<WH3947> but took the poor<WH7326> man<WH376>'s lamb,<WH3535> and dressed<WH6213> it for the man<WH376> who had come to him.<WH935>"

David<WH1732>'s anger<WH639> was greatly<WH3966> kindled<WH2734> against the man,<WH376> and he said<WH559> to Nathan,<WH5416> "As Yahweh<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> the man<WH376> who has done<WH6213> this is worthy<WH1121> to die!<WH4194>
He shall restore<WH7999> the lamb<WH3535> fourfold,<WH706> because<WH6118> he did<WH6213> this thing,<WH1697> and because<WH6118> he had no pity!<WH2550>"

Nathan<WH5416> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "You are the man.<WH376> This is what Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> says:<WH559> <WH4886> 'I anointed you king<WH4428> over Israel,<WH3478> and I delivered<WH5337> you out of the hand<WH3027> of Saul.<WH7586>

I gave<WH5414> you your master<WH113>'s house,<WH1004> and your master<WH113>'s wives<WH802> into your bosom,<WH2436> and gave<WH5414> you the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> and of Judah;<WH3063> and if that would have been too little,<WH4592> I would have added<WH3254> to you many more such<WH2007> things.<WH2007>

Why have you despised<WH959> the word<WH1697> of Yahweh,<WH3068> to do<WH6213> that which is evil<WH7451> in his sight?<WH5869> You have struck<WH5221> Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850> with the sword,<WH2719> and have taken<WH3947> his wife<WH802> to be your wife,<WH802> and have slain<WH2026> him with the sword<WH2719> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>

Now therefore the sword<WH2719> will never<WH5704> depart<WH5493> from your house,<WH1004> because<WH6118> you have despised<WH959> me,<WH3947> and have taken the wife<WH802> of Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850> to be your wife.<WH802>'

"This is what Yahweh<WH3068> says:<WH559> <WH6965> 'Behold, I will raise up evil<WH7451> against you out of your own house;<WH1004> and I will take<WH3947> your wives<WH802> before your eyes,<WH5869> and give<WH5414> them to your neighbor,<WH7453> and he will lie<WH7901> with your wives<WH802> in the sight<WH5869> of this sun.<WH8121>
For you did<WH6213> it secretly,<WH5643> but I will do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> before all Israel,<WH3478> and before the sun.<WH8121>'"

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Nathan,<WH5416> "I have sinned<WH2398> against Yahweh.<WH3068>" Nathan<WH5416> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Yahweh<WH3068> also has put away<WH5674> your sin.<WH2403> You will not die.<WH4191>

However,<WH657> because by this deed<WH1697> you have given<WH5006> great occasion<WH5006> to Yahweh<WH3068>'s enemies<WH341> to blaspheme,<WH5006> the child<WH1121> also who is born<WH3209> to you shall surely<WH4191> die.<WH4191>"
Nathan<WH5416> departed<WH3212> to his house.<WH1004> Yahweh<WH3068> struck<WH5062> the child<WH3206> that Uriah<WH223>'s wife<WH802> bore<WH3205> to David,<WH1732> and it was very sick.<WH605>
David<WH1732> therefore begged<WH1245> God<WH430> for the child;<WH5288> and David<WH1732> fasted,<WH6684> and went in,<WH935> and lay<WH7901> all night<WH3885> on the earth.<WH776>
The elders<WH2205> of his house<WH1004> arose<WH6965> beside him,<WH6965> to raise him up from the earth:<WH776> but he would<WH14> not,<WH1262> neither did he eat bread with them.<WH3899>

It happened on the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> that the child<WH3206> died.<WH4191> The servants<WH5650> of David<WH1732> feared<WH3372> to tell<WH5046> him that the child<WH3206> was dead;<WH4191> for they said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH3206> while the child was yet alive,<WH2416> we spoke<WH559> to him,<WH8085> and he didn't listen to our voice.<WH6963> How will he then<WH6213> harm<WH7451> himself,<WH6213> if we tell<WH559> him that the child<WH3206> is dead?<WH4191>"

But when David<WH1732> saw<WH7200> that his servants<WH5650> were whispering<WH3907> together,<WH1732> David perceived<WH995> that the child<WH3206> was dead;<WH4191> and David<WH1732> said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> "Is the child<WH3206> dead?<WH4191>" They said,<WH559> "He is dead.<WH4191>"

Then David<WH1732> arose<WH6965> from the earth,<WH776> and washed,<WH7364> and anointed<WH5480> himself,<WH2498> and changed his clothing;<WH8071> and he came<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and worshiped:<WH7812> then he came<WH935> to his own house;<WH1004> and when he required,<WH7592> they set<WH7760> bread<WH3899> before him,<WH398> and he ate.

Then his servants<WH5650> said<WH559> to him,<WH1697> "What is this that you have done?<WH6213> You fasted<WH6684> and wept<WH1058> for the child<WH3206> while he was alive;<WH2416> but when the child<WH3206> was dead,<WH4191> you rose<WH6965> up and ate<WH398> bread.<WH3899>"

He said,<WH559> "While the child<WH3206> was yet alive,<WH2416> I fasted<WH6684> and wept;<WH1058> for I said,<WH559> <WH3045> 'Who knows whether Yahweh<WH3068> will not be gracious<WH2603> to me,<WH3206> that the child may live?<WH2416>'
But now he is dead,<WH4191> why should I fast?<WH6684> Can<WH3201> I bring him back again?<WH7725> I shall go<WH1980> to him,<WH7725> but he will not return to me."

David<WH1732> comforted<WH5162> Bathsheba<WH1339> his wife,<WH802> and went in<WH935> to her,<WH7901> and lay with her.<WH3205> She bore a son,<WH1121> and he called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Solomon.<WH8010> Yahweh<WH3068> loved him;<WH157>
and he sent<WH7971> by the hand<WH3027> of Nathan<WH5416> the prophet;<WH5030> and he<WH7121> named<WH8034> him Jedidiah,<WH3041> for Yahweh<WH3068>'s sake.
Now Joab<WH3097> fought<WH3898> against Rabbah<WH7237> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> and took<WH3920> the royal<WH4410> city.<WH5892>
Joab<WH3097> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to David,<WH1732> and said,<WH559> "I have fought<WH3898> against Rabbah.<WH7237> Yes,<WH3920> I have taken the city<WH5892> of waters.<WH4325>

Now therefore gather<WH622> the rest<WH3499> of the people<WH5971> together,<WH622> and encamp<WH2583> against the city,<WH5892> and take<WH3920> it;<WH3920> lest I take the city,<WH5892> and it be called<WH7121> after my name.<WH8034>"
David<WH1732> gathered<WH622> all the people<WH5971> together,<WH622> and went<WH3212> to Rabbah,<WH7237> and fought<WH3898> against it,<WH3920> and took it.

He took<WH3947> the crown<WH5850> of their king<WH4428> from off his head;<WH7218> and its weight<WH4948> was a talent<WH3603> of gold,<WH2091> and in it were precious<WH3368> stones;<WH68> and it was set on David<WH1732>'s head.<WH7218> He brought out<WH3318> the spoil<WH7998> of the city,<WH5892> exceeding<WH3966> much.<WH7235>

He brought out<WH3318> the people<WH5971> who were therein,<WH7760> and put them under saws,<WH4050> and under iron<WH1270> picks,<WH2757> and under axes<WH4037> of iron,<WH1270> and made them pass<WH5674> through the brick kiln:<WH4404> and he did<WH6213> so to all the cities<WH5892> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983> David<WH1732> and all the people<WH5971> returned<WH7725> to Jerusalem.<WH3389>
